Posts.Title: I got that comment again! rrs StillKicking

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2008 07:36AM atw wrote: I agree that the wire was not as bad as I expected.  In my case, they squeezed extra hard with the mammogram machine and that hurt more than placing the wire!  If you made it through a core biopsy, this was similar but not as bad.  I thought it was a little rude that I never saw the doctor.  They had my head very turned to the left, and the nurse made sure I could see her face, but the doctor just came in, said hello, placed the wire, and left.  It was a strange feeling to never see his face!  When they did the dye, they did use the cream around the aerola.  They used a very tiny needle to put in the radioactive dye and there were 4 injections.  Only one of them stung a lot; the others weren't bad at all. It was freezing cold in there.  They gave me a heated blanket.  I wished that I had brought a sweater or something, because you do spend some time in the waiting room between procedures.  Also, you should have a book or something to read while you wait.
Posts.Title: SNB and wire localization Yvon1 Kathy_K
